text: [Music]
we started that journey with Telstra on
cloud backing in 2000 and 2008 in
Telstra's private private cloud so we've
got the sort of ten-year experience in
that space a few years ago I guess we're
getting to the point where the hardware
and infrastructure within that
environment was reaching end-of-life and
we'd come to a point where we needed to
make a decision as to our next steps and
direction initially we're looking at a
number of alternatives one of which was
migrating into the alternative Telstra
CSX environment at that point in time
Telstra and visi engaged with AWS to
look at some options in in the cloud
area with AWS and the decision was made
to go down the AWS path in 2016 there
were a number of reasons why we chose
AWS and primarily we wanted to remain in
the cloud space and we were looking for
a setup that was going to give us
flexibility cost reductions scale high
availability and all of that with with
the ability to be able to minimize our
costs and be flexible in terms of be
able to provide new solutions to our
business the benefits that we realized
as a result of the cloud migration
firstly cost benefits so we did have an
estimator around 25% reduction in our
cloud costs as a result of of the
migration going to AWS means that weeks
to provision has been turned into hours
to provision replication and
environments is cost effective to the
extent that we can we can stand up an
environment for a period of weeks do a
proof-of-concept bring it back down
until we're ready to actually make that
a live solution and so the benefit of
being able to do that is significant
you
